author: Lindsey Granger, opinion contributor
description: This is not about open borders or closed borders. It is about whether America decides that looking American is enough. Or whether some people will always be asked to prove it.
title: Ilhan Omar says ICE pulled over her son; racial profiling?

author: Julia Shapero
description: Three Senate Democrats said Tuesday that they are investigating the impact of data centers on consumer electricity bills amid concerns that the expansion of energy-hungry artificial intelligence (AI) infrastructure is driving up costs.  Sens. Elizabeth Warren (D-Mass.), Chris Van Hollen (D-Md.) and Richard Blumenthal (D-Conn.) pressed Google, Microsoft, Amazon, Meta and several other tech firms about their data center buildouts and agreements…
title: Democrats press tech giants over data center energy use, rising electricity bills

author: Robby Soave, opinion contributor
description: Yes, it’s true that Rob Reiner hated Trump, had called him mentally unfit for office, and inveighed against the president repeatedly on social media. But here, that old adage is quite appropriate: If you don’t have something nice to say, just say nothing.
title: Trump is wrong for politicizing Rob Reiner’s murder

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: The new White House ballroom is expected to be finished by 2028, with the addition providing a new gathering space for guests at the direction of President Trump. The project’s projected completion date was revealed in a National Park Service report about the construction, authored by Deputy Director Frank Land and approved by acting Director…
title: White House ballroom expected to be completed by 2028

author: Jos Joseph, opinion contributor
description: James Talarico, a Texas state representative and devout Christian, has gained attention for using his faith to advance liberal policies and has now announced his candidacy for the 2026 U.S. Senate race.
title: James Talarico might be the antidote to MAGA Christianity

author: Filip Timotija
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said Tuesday that the Pentagon will not release the full, unedited video of the U.S. military’s September strike on an alleged drug boat, when 11 “narco-terrorists” were killed, including two survivors in a follow-up strike.  “In keeping with long-standing Department of War policy … Department of Defense policy, of course, we’re…
title: Hegseth: Pentagon won’t release full video of Sept. 2 boat strikes

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: White House National Economic Council Director Kevin Hassett on Tuesday brushed aside concerns that his close proximity to President Trump could influence his decisions as the next potential chair of the Federal Reserve. “The idea that being close to the president and serving the president well disqualifies someone for any job just doesn’t make any…
title: Hassett brushes off concerns that closeness to Trump risks Fed independence

author: Jason Ambrosi, opinion contributor
description: The professionals ensuring the safety of the entire U.S. air transportation system deserve better, and so does the flying public.
title: Congress must ensure US Air safety is never again a political bargaining chip

author: Al Weaver
description: Sen. Susan Collins (R-Maine) on Tuesday labeled President Trump’s comments about the death of Rob Reiner “inexplicable.” A day after Reiner and his wife were found stabbed to death in their Los Angeles home, Trump posted on social media that the actor and director died “due to the anger he caused others” via “Trump Derangement…
title: Collins calls Trump comments on Reiner death ‘inexplicable’

author: Ryan Mancini
description: Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-S.C.) on Monday cast blame on former Presidents Obama and Biden after a mass shooting at Australia’s Bondi Beach during a Hanukkah event killed 15 people and injured 25. Graham condemned the shooting in an appearance on Fox News’s “Hannity” when he said, “Obama and Biden have a lot to do with…
title: Graham: Obama, Biden ‘have a lot to do’ with Australia Hanukkah attack

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Sen. Mark Kelly (D-Ariz.) said the Pentagon’s probe of his conduct does not seem “very serious,” despite its recent escalation from a preliminary review into an “official Command Investigation.” Kelly, a retired Navy captain, said in a Tuesday interview on MS NOW’s “Morning Joe” that he still has not been notified of the probe by…
title: Kelly on Pentagon review escalation: ‘It doesn’t seem … very serious’

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Sen. Chris Coons (D-Del.), a staunch ally of former President Biden on Capitol Hill, says that Democrats need to reevaluate their fundamental message to voters and to “stop telling Americans how to be and what to feel and believe.” He said leaders of the Democratic Party instead “need to listen” to voters and solve their…
title: Coons: Democrats need to stop telling Americans ‘what to feel and believe’

author: Kathleen O’Toole, opinion contributor
description: Restoring literacy demands we treat reading as more than a skill, but as a gateway to wisdom and understanding.
title: Experts and ideologues broke literacy. Here’s how to fix it.

author: Emily Brooks
description: Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) said there will not be an amendment vote on extending expiring ObamaCare enhanced subsidies as part of a House Republican health care bill this week, in a move that is infuriating moderate Republicans who had been pushing to go on the record about the subsidies. Johnson said at a press conference…
title: House GOP will not allow amendment vote to extend ObamaCare subsidies

author: Bill Press, opinion contributor
description: The National Historic Trust has filed a lawsuit against President Trump, the Department of Interior, the National Park Service, the General Services Administration, and their heads, to halt construction of the new ballroom in the White House, arguing that it was done illegally and without any review or public input.
title: ‘Stop the music’ in Trump’s big ballroom

author: The Hill Staff
description: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-N.Y.) is leading the push for the Trump administration to follow through with releasing documents related to the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. The pressure campaign comes after President Trump signed the Epstein Files Transparency Act into law last month, which compels the Justice Department to release files and…
title: Watch live: Schumer, Senate Dems press administration on release of Epstein files

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Jewish groups in the United States are urging their counterparts to increase security precautions after a recent attack during a Hanukkah celebration on Bondi Beach in Sydney, Australia. At least 15 people were killed and dozens were injured in the violent event overseas. “We need to ask these hard questions. We need to be smart…
title: US Jewish groups urge heightened security at public events after Hanukkah celebration targeted

author: The Hill Staff
description: House Democratic leaders will speak with reporters Tuesday morning as the battle to address rising health care premiums persists on Capitol Hill. Affordable Care Act subsidies, or enhanced tax credits that keep insurance costs lower for struggling Americans, are set to expire at the end of the month — a major point of contention during…
title: Watch live: House Democrats speak amid health care battle

author: Julia Manchester
description: White House chief of staff Susie Wiles forcefully pushed back on the framing of a sweeping Vanity Fair interview published on Tuesday, calling a “disingenuously framed hit piece” on her, President Trump, the Cabinet, and White House staff.  “Significant context was disregarded and much of what I, and others, said about the team and the…
title: Wiles slams Vanity Fair interview as ‘disingenuously framed hit piece’

author: Bridget Todd, opinion contributor
description: Minstrel shows died out, but we’re witnessing their second act in the digital realm.
title: Digital blackface: Racist AI content is fueling the SNAP debate

description: Australian police said Tuesday the suspects in connection with the deadly mass shooting at a Hanukkah event at Bondi Beach on Sunday were inspired by the Islamic State. Australian Federal Police Commissioner Krissy Barrett said at a press conference there were “early indications” the suspects, a father and son, were “inspired by Islamic State,” Reuters…

description: Vice President Vance will give remarks in Pennsylvania on Tuesday morning as President Trump is facing pressure over rising inflation and affordability concerns. His visit to the Keystone State comes about a week after Trump traveled to the state to sell his economic agenda following key Republican losses in the 2025 elections and as the…
title: Watch live: Vance to tout Trump economic agenda in Pennsylvania

description: The 2025 National Security Strategy does as much to undermine the international order that the U.S. was once proud to lead and protect as anything Russia and China have done.
title: Trump’s National Security Strategy is an incoherent cop-out

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: David Urban, who served as a senior adviser on President Trump’s 2016 campaign, called Trump’s remarks on the death of acclaimed actor-director Rob Reiner “indefensible” and suggested they could hurt the GOP in next year’s midterms. “First of all, my condolences go out to the Reiner family. It’s a terrible tragedy that they’ve suffered here,…

description: White House chief of staff Susie Wiles said in an interview published Tuesday that she was at first “aghast” at Elon Musk’s dismantling of the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID). “I was initially aghast,” Wiles told author Chris Whipple in an article published in Vanity Fair. “Because I think anybody that pays attention to…
title: Wiles was ‘initially aghast’ at Elon Musk-led evisceration of USAID

author: The Hill Staff
description: Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) Administrator Bryan Bedford will testify before the House Transportation and Infrastructure Committee on Tuesday morning on the state of air travel. The hearing comes less than a month after the record-long government shutdown ended. During the 43-day lapse in funding, Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy and the FAA implemented flight reductions at…
title: Watch live: FAA chief testifies before House on air travel

author: Julia Manchester
description: White House chief of staff Susie Wiles said in a sweeping interview published Tuesday that Vice President Vance has been a “conspiracy theorist” for a decade. Wiles made the remarks during a Vanity Fair interview in which she discussed various administration officials’ understanding of how important President Trump’s base of supporters considered the release of…
title: Wiles says Vance has been a ‘conspiracy theorist for a decade’

author: James D. Zirin, opinion contributor
description: Donald Trump is about to get the green light from the Supreme Court to proceed with his MAGA plan to dismantle the administrative state.
title: The Supreme Court’s opening wedge to end independent agencies

author: The Hill Staff
description: Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) and House Republican leaders will speak with reporters Tuesday morning as Affordable Care Act subsidies are set to expire at the end of the month. GOP lawmakers in the lower chamber of Congress unveiled their own version of a health care bill, which included broadly popular items among the conference —…
title: Watch live: House Republicans give remarks amid pressure to extend ACA subsidies

author: Julia Manchester
description: Attorney General Pam Bondi “whiffed” on understanding how much President Trump’s base of supporters cared about the release of the files linked to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, White House chief of staff Susie Wiles says in a newly-released interview.  “I think she completely whiffed on appreciating that that was the very targeted group that…
title: Wiles says Bondi ‘whiffed’ on Trump supporters’ interest in Epstein files

author: Brett Samuels
description: White House chief of staff Susie Wiles in a new interview said that she and President Trump had a “loose agreement” to move on from “score settling” after the first 90 days of his second term, but acknowledged that his attacks against his opponents may “look like retribution” in some cases. Wiles’ comments came in…
title: Susie Wiles talks Trump’s score-settling and retribution

author: Gleb Tsipursky, opinion contributor
description: Picture a budget meeting at a government agency or a boardroom in a multinational firm. A generative AI system has drafted a cash-flow projection, summarized a 200-page policy report, and suggested a pricing tweak or benefits change. The prose looks polished, the charts look clean — but a faulty calculation, buried deep within the math, quietly pushes the decision…
title: Don’t throw the generative baby out with the AI bathwater

author: The Hill Staff
description: Lawmakers on Tuesday are scrambling to hammer out plans to address rising insurance premium costs before their holiday recess, as the expiration of Affordable Care Act subsidies looms large. The House Rules committee meets at 2 p.m., with the GOP leadership health plan on its agenda. Moderate Republicans will push for an amendment that includes…
title: Live updates: House, Senate attempt to move ahead on health plans with deadline looming

author: Sylvan Lane
description: The U.S. added 64,000 jobs in November as the unemployment rate rose to 4.6 percent, according to delayed data released Tuesday by the Labor Department. Economists had forecasted a gain of 40,000 jobs and 4.4 percent unemployment rate, according to consensus estimates. The report was delayed by more than a week due to the 43-day government…
title: US added 64K jobs in November, unemployment up slightly

author: Merrill Matthews, opinion contributor
description: Despite President Trump's claims of an "A+++++" economy, rising bankruptcy rates among businesses, farmers, and health care companies indicate that the economy is facing significant challenges that need to be addressed.
title: Why would an A+++++ economy have so many bankruptcies?

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Former first lady Michelle Obama said she was supposed to see acclaimed actor-director Rob Reiner and his wife, Michele Singer Reiner, just hours after they were found stabbed to death in their home in Los Angeles on Sunday. “We’ve known them for many, many years, and we were supposed to be seeing them that night.…
title: Michelle Obama on death of Rob Reiner, wife: ‘We were supposed to be seeing them that night’

author: Teddy Grant
description: Reiner and Singer were found dead inside their Brentwood, California home on Sunday suffering from stab wounds, KTLA has confirmed.
title: Who was Michele Singer? Rob Reiner’s wife and creative partner

author: Austin Sarat, opinion contributor
description: Rather than assuming that anyone called to testify against a defendant in open court can do so truthfully and effectively, courts should adopt a more nuanced and contextual approach.
title: Supreme Court didn’t do enough to make the ‘right to confront’ meaningful

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Sen. John Kennedy (R-La.) said Monday that President Trump should not have weighed in on the deaths of acclaimed actor and director Rob Reiner and his wife, Michele Singer Reiner, who were found with stab wounds over the weekend at their home in Los Angeles. Kennedy joined a growing chorus of Republicans pushing back on…
title: Senate Republican on Trump’s Reiner post: I think he ‘should have said nothing’

author: The Associated Press
description: Creepy, zany and demonstrably fake content is often called “slop.” The word's proliferation online, in part thanks to the widespread availability of generative artificial intelligence, landed it Merriam-Webster's 2025 word of the year.
title: Merriam-Webster’s word of the year for 2025 is ‘slop,’ and here’s why

author: Justin McCall, opinion contributor
description: The Army, built for sustained heavy occupation, cannot deploy a brigade in under a month. The Marines, in contrast, are designed to deploy within 24 hours.
title: Semper folly: Abolishing the Marines would ignore history, geography

description: Researchers found melanoma-linked DNA damage extended to areas of the body usually sheltered from sun.
title: Tanning beds cause melanoma-linked DNA damage: Study

author: Nina Teicholz, opinion contributor
description: As people cut more saturated fat, the nation grew heavier and sicker — not healthier.
title: The war on saturated fat, never based on good science, can now end

description: Banks, fintechs and emerging digital asset firms are all working to build systems that are faster, more accessible and more interconnected. However, these industry changes bring their own set of risks and challenges for policymakers to address. How can innovation and oversight advance together to reinforce trust in the financial system? What does responsible modernization…
title: Watch live: Modern Money — The Next Chapter in Banking, Regulation & Financial Trust

author: Chris Stirewalt
description: It’s been fewer than 100 days since the assassination of Charlie Kirk. It will take years to know the implications of one of the most historically significant events of 2025, but the early returns are not encouraging. Two data points from this week:  1) Kirk’s widow, Erika, had a summit with one of her late…
title: 2 unhappy indicators on the effects of the assassination of Charlie Kirk

author: Judy Kurtz
description: A history-making menorah — which made its debut under former President Biden — is not on display as part of the Trump White House’s annual holiday decor this year. The candelabra — created by the Executive Residence Carpentry Shop using historic wood from 1600 Pennsylvania Ave. — became the first menorah to ever be added to the White House…
title: History-making menorah unveiled under Biden not on display in Trump White House

author: Al Weaver
description: A bipartisan group of senators is making a renewed push toward finding a health care solution as the hour-glass winds down to the end-of-month deadline to extend the enhanced Affordable Care Act (ACA) subsidies. Roughly 20 senators met Monday night at the invitation of Sen. Susan Collins (R-Maine), with lawmakers using a proposal from her and Sen.…
title: Senate health care talks flicker to life as ObamaCare deadline nears

author: Julia Manchester
description: President Trump’s approach to foreign policy in Venezuela is presenting a stark contrast with his approach to other countries as he seeks to escalate tensions with the South American country.  While Trump has presented himself as a peacemaker around the world, he has increased the U.S. military presence in the Caribbean in response to what…
title: Trump confronts Venezuela while de-escalating elsewhere

author: Alexander Bolton
description: President Trump has picked a fight with allied MAGA conservatives on Capitol Hill by issuing an executive order to chill state efforts to regulate artificial intelligence (AI), a proposal similar to one that conservative critics of Big Tech defeated on Capitol Hill earlier this month. Trump is trying to avoid an open fight with Republicans…
title: Trump picks fight with MAGA allies in issuing AI executive order

author: Max Rego
description: Republican Rep. Mike Lawler (N.Y.) said Monday that President Trump changing marijuana’s classification would be ill-advised. “I think rescheduling marijuana is wrong. The fact is, marijuana is a gateway drug. Most of the people who end up using hard substances start out on marijuana,” Lawler told host Blake Burman on “The Hill.” The president said…
title: GOP Rep. Lawler says it would be ‘wrong’ for Trump to reclassify marijuana

author: Filip Timotija
description: The Pentagon is escalating its preliminary review into Sen. Mark Kelly (D-Ariz.) over his participation in a video where he and other Democrats told U.S. service members to disobey “illegal orders.” A Pentagon official told The Hill on Monday that Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth’s office, along with the Defense Department’s Office of General Counsel, are…
title: Pentagon escalates review into Sen. Kelly over ‘illegal orders’ video

author: Filip Timotija
description: The U.S. military continued its campaign against alleged drug-trafficking boats, blowing up three vessels in the eastern Pacific on Monday and killing eight “narcoterrorists” in total.  All three vessels were operated by designated terrorist organizations and were targeted in international waters. It is unclear which terrorist groups the U.S. military was referring to.  Three people…
title: US military blows up 3 alleged drug boats in eastern Pacific, killing 8 ‘narco-terrorists’

author: Max Rego
description: President Trump on Monday filed suit against the BBC, calling the way it edited a clip of his Jan. 6, 2021, speech to supporters before the U.S. Capitol attack was “false, deceptive, and defamatory.” The suit, filed in U.S. District Court in Southern Florida, says that the outlet used its “Trump: A Second Chance?” documentary,…
title: Trump sues BBC for libel after documentary edited his Jan. 6 speech

author: Max Rego
description: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-Ga.) put a ring on it.  Greene, who is departing Congress next month, confirmed her engagement Monday to Brian Glenn, the chief White House correspondent for conservative outlet Real America’s Voice.  Glenn posted a photo of Greene wearing an engagement ring to the social platform X on Monday evening, saying, “She…
title: Brian Glenn says he’s engaged to Marjorie Taylor Greene

author: Max Rego
description: Police in Providence, R.I., and the FBI released new photos and video of a person of interest in Saturday’s deadly shooting at Brown University, as the manhunt for the gunman passes 48 hours. In one video, the individual, donning a dark green and gray jacket, dark shoes, dark pants, a dark beanie and a dark…
title: Police share videos of new person of interest in Brown shooting; FBI offers $50K reward
